website_summaries.verdict: This above-the-ankle hiking boot from Sorel may come off as a desirable investment because of its remarkable comfort and arch support. The outdoor community also appreciates this footgear’s lightness and water protection.On the other hand, this hiker garners criticism because of how its sole separates from the upper after minimal usage. Nevertheless, the Sorel Madson Hiker’s urban and trail-centric attributes may help adventurers come out on top, as long as they overlook its faults.
pros: Droves of customers are happy to report that the Sorel Madson Hiker is a delightfully comfortable hiking boot
A bunch of users finds its arch support to be very satisfactory
According to a couple of consumer reviews, the break-in period of this Sorel product is minimal
More than a handful of outdoorsy individuals are glad about the Madson Hiker’s waterproofness
A minority of Sorel Madson Hiker reviews declare that this is an insanely lightweight boot for hiking
Its versatility, both for urban environments and outdoor trails, is refreshing, based on the opinion of several shoppers
cons: Several outdoor enthusiasts say that the Sorel Madson Hiker’s sole comes apart after a few uses
Some find this vintage-looking hiking boot too narrow for their tastes
A few customers state that its sole performs poorly on wet and slippery surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant boots, love them!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these boots! So comfy! Like a big pair of slippers. Miles better than the Timberlands I had originally ordered. I will definitely be sticking to Sorel in the future. Its really hard to find boots you can just live in despite the sheer volume of choice available...and I must already own about 20 pairs. My wife also bought a pair of Sorels this week and she loves hers too.
customer_reviews.author: FilletOfish

customer_reviews.title: warm, waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Felt a little too large when I first tried on but works well with thick winter socks and left room for the support insert I wanted to put in. All in all very happy with them - really keep the feet warm despite freezing wet weather and are super comfy to walk around in. Definitely wouldn't hike in them but I didn't buy them for serious walking.
customer_reviews.author: London Ipsum

customer_reviews.title: different prices for different size boots ..??
customer_reviews.text: the boots were not very wide fitting ..and ordered size 11 but they were to big .. so ideally need a 10.5 ..but very expensive ...dont no why different sizes are different prices ...???
customer_reviews.author: james morrison

customer_reviews.title: Functional but maybe not that rugged
customer_reviews.text: Nice leather. Not exactly fashion boots but don't think they're really meant for intensive hill walking. Laces too short. Fit
customer_reviews.author: Casual Observer

customer_reviews.title: Would have  preferred dark brown but was to much
customer_reviews.text: Nice durable and comfortable didn’t like the colour of the laces so change them to brown that look good, Best advice I can give is make sure you go for your uk shoe size.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: Only been on a few dog walks but they seem fine. They’ve kept the water out when it’s been a little wet and are very comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Jonny

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: It was more than my expectations to the quality and fit and also to the design
customer_reviews.author: Konstantinos

customer_reviews.title: Really comfy after a few hours but needed wearing in - not comfy at first.
customer_reviews.text: Really comfy after a few hours but needed wearing in - not comfy at first.
customer_reviews.author: andrew fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably my best bargain of the year.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots because I wanted a waterproof boot with a good gripping sole that was also presentable enough to wear around town. I wasn't disappointed - they fit are soft and comfortable and look great. At £68 they were an astounding bargain, and the day they were delivered The Guardian newspaper featured them in its top 10 mens shoes for AW19 - at £190!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pleiomedes

customer_reviews.title: These Boots are made for walking
customer_reviews.text: These are definitely made for walking. I am wearing them now and are very comfortable not heavy and cumbersome liking wearing bricks which I have done in the past and most recently too. Of course, you would find comfort in a top brand like Sorel and these are ideal for walking and hiking which they are made for as well. They look good on as well it will better when they have been worn a bit so they looked lived in. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M.

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking boot.
customer_reviews.text: Boots turned up today and I have to say they were everything I wanted and more, stylish and very comfortable. The service from the supplier was excellent and the arrived 14 days before expected deliver date excellent service. You do need to take into account that the addition of carriage and import duty though which added another £36 on the price. That is why I gave 4 stars. That said I would still use the supplier purely on service.
customer_reviews.author: Simon N.

customer_reviews.title: After so much research and doubts, worth it
customer_reviews.text: Definitely they look better in flesh than in the picture. They are super comfortable and they are not that heavy. To be honest I have no negative points so far but it’s only been a week.
customer_reviews.author: Rodrigo

customer_reviews.title: One walking holiday, soles coming off
customer_reviews.text: Looking at other reviews here, it seems that the quality of the sole is a clear issue. Wore these boots for a couple of days walking in the Lakes, and the soles are now coming off. It seems to me that these boots simply won't cut it if you want to actually use them for hiking. I am trying to get in touch with the seller, but no luck yet.
customer_reviews.author: henry meller

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Great boots, more of a good solid crossover winter boot than a full on walking boot, not as heavy or bulky. Never had any issues with Sorel boots personally, always good quality and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Learningtowalkagain

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. Not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable boots. Not very durable. Rubber of sole started falling apart at front. Hope replacement pair last longer.
customer_reviews.author: c s adfield

customer_reviews.title: comfortable fit
customer_reviews.text: Received the boots following day went out to try them 6 mile walk over the moors wet under foot, they are water proof and the fit is great would strongly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Good looking, bit large and with lousy tongue.
customer_reviews.text: I really can't appreciate the tongue. It has an excess amount of leather which folds (creases) which can put pressure on the leg if boots are tied tighter. I still didn't return them although above mentioned was obvious from the beginning. Mainly because they look so great and there are few alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seller return policy
customer_reviews.text: Shoes looked great. I had to return them and was charged £11 by Post Office. as seller do not pay it. I wanted a smaller size but now I will go elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: Sorel Madson Hiker Waterproof, Men's Classic Boots
product_meta.description: This traditional outdoor-style boot combines the comfort of a trainer with waterproof sealed seams and classic aesthetics. As a result it is both robust and elegant thanks to the waterproof leather or suede instep and the metal eyelets inspired by mountaineers. Walk trails or cross puddles in the city with this stylish boot.
